summary: This is an internal DOJ Office of the Inspector General email discussing the Bureau of Prisons' plan to conduct an after-action investigation into facility security surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. The email notes that historically such BOP investigations don't involve interviews and references the similar Whitey Bulger incident.

events.title: Epstein Incident
events.description: The death of Jeffrey Epstein while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, referenced as the incident prompting a BOP after-action investigation.

events.title: Whitey Bulger Incident
events.description: A previous incident involving the death of inmate James 'Whitey' Bulger in federal custody, referenced as a precedent for how BOP after-action investigations are conducted.

events.title: BOP After-Action Investigation Announcement
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons announces it will conduct an after-action investigation into facility security surrounding Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (implied location of Epstein incident)
One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor (DOJ OIG New York Field Office)
keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons planned to conduct an after-action investigation into facility security surrounding Epstein's death.
Historically, BOP after-action investigations have been conducted without interviews according to the email.
The email references the Whitey Bulger incident as a precedent where BOP investigations didn't interfere with OIG or FBI investigations.
The communication originated from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General's New York Field Office.
The email was sent on August 13, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death.
